Wisdom: النَّوْمُ رَاحَةٌ مِنْ أَلَمٍ وَمُلَائِمُهُ الْمَوْتُ
enWisdom: Sleep is a relief from pain and its counterpart is death

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ تُحْفَةِ الْمُؤْمِنِ الْمَوْتُ [أَفْضَلُ تُحْفَةِ الْمَوْتِ أَشَدُّ مَا يُتَمَنَّى الْخَلَاصُ مِنْهُ بِالْمَوْتِ‏]
enWisdom: The best gift for a believer is death

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَوْلِيَاءَ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى كُلُّ مُسْتَقْرِبٍ أَجَلَهُ مُكَذِّبٍ أَمَلَهُ كَثِيرٍ عَمَلُهُ قَلِيلٍ زَلَلُهُ
enWisdom: Verily the friends of Allah, the Most High, include all those who consider their death to be near, belie their [false] hopes, and have many good deeds and only a few mistakes

Wisdom: إِنَّ فِي الْمَوْتِ لَرَاحَةً لِمَنْ كَانَ عَبْدَ شَهْوَتِهِ وَأَسِيرَ أَهْوِيَتِهِ لِأَنَّهُ كُلَّمَا طَالَتْ حَيَاتُهُ كَثُرَتْ سَيِّئَاتُهُ وَعَظُمَتْ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ جِنَايَاتُهُ
enWisdom: Verily death is a relief for the one who was a slave to his lust and a prisoner of his vain desire, because the more his life lengthened the more his sins would increase and his offenses against his soul would become worse

Wisdom: مَنْ بَلَغَ غَايَةَ أَمَلِهِ فَلْيَتَوَقَّعْ حُلُولَ أَجَلِهِ
enWisdom: One who reaches the end of his hopes should expect the arrival of his death
In death there is comfort for the felicitous
In death there is [either] delight or regret
What an excellent cure death is!
How excellent a son-in-law the grave is!
There is no soother like death
